headshotImage.caption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Markram b Duminy 76 (63b 12x4 0x6 105m) SR: 120.63

dismissalComment.html: taken at short midwicket. You could see even against Tahir that the slower it got, the more edgy Dhawan was getting. Duminy floated this up at off stump. He stepped out and had to end up reaching out with hard hands. Got it off the inside half of the bat and ended up chipping wide of midwicket who leaped to his left and took it high

headshotImage.caption: JP Duminy headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: JP Duminy headshot

headshotImage.caption: S Dhawan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: S Dhawan headshot

dismissalComment.html: taken at short midwicket. You could see even against Tahir that the slower it got, the more edgy Dhawan was getting. Duminy floated this up at off stump. He stepped out and had to end up reaching out with hard hands. Got it off the inside half of the bat and ended up chipping wide of midwicket who leaped to his left and took it high

headshotImage.caption: AM Rahane headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: AM Rahane headshot

dismissalComment.html: and he's made Rahane play a poor shot. A small play from Markram, putting a fielder in the batsman's sight. And one dot ball later, Rahane feels the need to step out again. Once again, he's beaten in the flight. Dips and drifts away from him. He's reaching out and his bottom hand is coming off. It's a feeble chip to long-off off the bottom of the bat

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hardik Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gets him to edge. Pandya slashes hard at a length ball outside off. Through the shot a tad early and he isn't close to the pitch of it. Hardly any feet. Morris gets marginal lift and it's a kiss of the edge

headshotImage.caption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c Klaasen b Rabada 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: trying to withdraw the bat, but the ball takes the inside edge! Why? It's because of the length and pace. The indecisive length - Rohit doesn't know whether to come forward or go back - and Rabada's pace - more then 135 kmph. It all results in an uncertainty in Rohit's play. A thin inside edge as the ball seams back, and Klaasen has his first catch in international cricket. Lovely start from Rabada

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c Ngidi b Imran Tahir 10 (22b 0x4 0x6 38m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: Dhoni picks out long-on, 10 off 22. A proper struggle. Some flight from Tahir, Dhoni comes down, doesn't get to the pitch but goes through with the stroke anyway. It doesn't have great timing so it's easily taken at long-on.

dismissalText.commentary: Kedar Jadhav c Klaasen b Phehlukwayo 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: and just as I say that, he strikes! Good length outside off, Jadhav goes reaching, trying to dab one down to third man but all he can get is a thick edge to the keeper. There's extra bounce in this surface. He didn't account for that

headshotImage.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy lbw b Chahal 51 (67b 4x4 0x6 83m) SR: 76.11

dismissalComment.html: and Duminy's given now and he opts to review! Flat delivery outside off, the ball spins back in and hits Duminy in front of leg. He has missed a straight one, he went way back but like de Kock in the first ODI, he just misses one. Three reds on HawkEye, so SA lose their set man and the review. Sinking again against wristspin.

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Aiden Markram st Dhoni b Kuldeep Yadav 32 (42b 2x4 1x6 64m) SR: 76.19

dismissalComment.html: beaten in flight, beaten by turn, Dhoni completes the job. Doesn't manage to get to the pitch, which has been a feature of his batting against spin today. Looks to force it into the leg side as the ball continues to drift away. Dhoni does it as easy as he always does and walks towards the bowler in the same motion

headshotImage.caption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kuldeep Yadav player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: beaten in flight, beaten by turn, Dhoni completes the job. Doesn't manage to get to the pitch, which has been a feature of his batting against spin today. Looks to force it into the leg side as the ball continues to drift away. Dhoni does it as easy as he always does and walks towards the bowler in the same motion

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: dead in front. Morris done in by natural variation. It keeps low as he goes on the back foot. In the end, he has to get down on his knees and swipe across the line to try and make a sweep out of it. It skids under the blade and hits him on the back thigh, right in front of the stumps. No doubt there, it was pitching in line. India brought back a wristpinner to get Morris, they've got him first ball

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: his response is to go the other way and cover those two stumps this time. Kuldeep floats it outside off and wide from him. The loop beats him as he goes across the line and another top edge is taken easily at extra cover

headshotImage.caption: Lungi Ngidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lungi Ngidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and that's what he does. Wrong'un straightens from middle stump at a good length. Ngidi looks for the slog again and he's struck in front of off stump

headshotImage.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Yuzvendra Chahal player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: 73 kph, an appeal and given! Flat down leg, Klaasen misses a flick and is struck in front of middle. Klaasen just can't connect with a nudge, the ball pitches and spins past the outside edge and hits Klaasen in front of off. There was some doubt about whether it pitched in line. JP, I think, asked him to carry on, but it was worth the review. Pitched in line, says HawkEye.

headshotImage.caption: JP Duminy headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: JP Duminy headshot

dismissalComment.html: and Duminy's given now and he opts to review! Flat delivery outside off, the ball spins back in and hits Duminy in front of leg. He has missed a straight one, he went way back but like de Kock in the first ODI, he just misses one. Three reds on HawkEye, so SA lose their set man and the review. Sinking again against wristspin.

headshotImage.caption: Khaya Zondo, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Khaya Zondo, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: Zondo takes the early release as he steps out and swings across the line. Chahal might have taken wickets like this in local leagues - just tosses it up slow at an off stump line and lets the batsman do the rest. Zondo nowhere near the pitch, head looking in the direction of midwicket, bat coming down from gully, feet pointed at square leg. The ball keeps it's trajectory and ends up on the off side, in extra cover's hands

headshotImage.caption: Imran Tahir headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Imran Tahir headshot

dismissalComment.html: another heave, another top edge. Length ball floated up at off stump. Goes for the old slog sweep and it hangs up for Kohli in the wide mid-on area. He takes with a reverse cup

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla lbw b Bumrah 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: traps him in front! Amla caught in the crease even as he's shuffling. Bumrah bowls a regulation length ball slanted in at off stump. Amla very deep in the crease as he looks to defend, as he is wont to do. Misses the ball and after a brief chat, decides against the review

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Dhoni b Bumrah 25 (42b 1x4 0x6 53m) SR: 59.52

dismissalComment.html: and then the pressure is on Miller, so he looks for a big shot and he perishes! On Zondo equally, I'm afraid, this wicket. Back of a length around middle and leg, Miller looks for a big slog, but he gets a thin inside edge through to the keeper. Miller tried, looking for runs, but the pressure was too much.

dismissalText.commentary: Lungi Ngidi lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 6 (6b 1x4 0x6 6m) SR: 100

commentTextItems.html: and that's what he does. Wrong'un straightens from middle stump at a good length. Ngidi looks for the slog again and he's struck in front of off stump

commentPostTextItems.html: 8:27pm And that's all from Nikhil, Ranjith and me today. We, of course, have plenty of analysis and press conference stuff to follow. So keep your eyes out for those and if you're in the Indian subcontinent, don't forget to head to our homepage and catch all the highlights on either side of the scorecell. Good night!

Kohli: Well the tour didn't start of too well but I knew I had to come in and get stuck in for us to compete in every game. Feels very good that it's coming off in winning causes. It started off with good pace and bounce. The new ball was hitting the bat nicely with pace. It was a drastic change after the 30th over and we immediately chopped down out target from 330 to 280-290. You're always looking for someone to get bat till the end and it's amazing if you do it as the captain. Another good partnership with Shikhar and a good stand with Bhuvi in the end as well. I was cramping towards the end but knew I had to stay till the end to get us 300. These are the times you're tested mentally as well as physically. [The spinners] We wanted to give them the pressure of defending today and it worked out. The intensity will be more in the fourth game because we can't lose this series anymore. I'm sure they'll come all guns blazing so we want to close that door.
Virat Kohli is the Man of the Match.

Markram: Everything is disappointing about this. Yet again not up to the mark. we've got ourselves to blame, have to try harder. I felt when we're in the field we were in. We managed to claw our way back and restrict them to 303 which I though was chaseable. Unfortunately we didn't take it deep enough and you don't win a match like that. We've come across them [spinners] and after all that time if we're still struggling to pick them, it speaks of their quality. It's a bit about that and about confidence as well. [About AB returning for the 4th ODI] I'd love it! I think that would spur the guys on.

Ishan Jain: "SA lost a wicket every over from over 36 to 40. They are looking totally trapped by these two talented spinners, things looking dark for the home side."

Sdtm: "I can't understand this SA batting none sense. Surely they knew what was coming their way in form of wrist spin. It's a shameful way of preparing and only relying on AB and FAF. Kudos to India they know what their doing. From a disgruntled SA fan in Germany. "

Nisarg Chokshi: "Once again, SA bow down to the wrist spinners, who take 8 wickets among them. I can hardly remember any other left-arm, right-arm wrist spinner duo causing havoc to the opposition."

Jas Goria : "Indian spinners again proving to be a curse for SA. Again 8 wickets for Indian spinners taking the tally to 21 wickets out of 28 total. Great performance. "

8:07pm India have gone 3-0 up. Firdose's match report will land soon, but in the mean time, you could read the one from the second ODI and the story won't be too different. South Africa folding against the spinners yet again. If last match was an eye-opener, this match is a proper low. Yet again, they have come nowhere near answering India's spinners. A 124-run win. This time, Kuldeep helps himself to career-best figures. All set up by another glorious Kohli innings - 160 not out from the Indian captain when they looked in some trouble of their own through the middle.

dismissalComment.html: trying to withdraw the bat, but the ball takes the inside edge! Why? It's because of the length and pace. The indecisive length - Rohit doesn't know whether to come forward or go back - and Rabada's pace - more then 135 kmph. It all results in an uncertainty in Rohit's play. A thin inside edge as the ball seams back, and Klaasen has his first catch in international cricket. Lovely start from Rabada

dismissalText.commentary: Heinrich Klaasen lbw b Chahal 6 (12b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: 73 kph, an appeal and given! Flat down leg, Klaasen misses a flick and is struck in front of middle. Klaasen just can't connect with a nudge, the ball pitches and spins past the outside edge and hits Klaasen in front of off. There was some doubt about whether it pitched in line. JP, I think, asked him to carry on, but it was worth the review. Pitched in line, says HawkEye.

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c Dhoni b Bumrah 25 (42b 1x4 0x6 53m) SR: 59.52

dismissalComment.html: and then the pressure is on Miller, so he looks for a big shot and he perishes! On Zondo equally, I'm afraid, this wicket. Back of a length around middle and leg, Miller looks for a big slog, but he gets a thin inside edge through to the keeper. Miller tried, looking for runs, but the pressure was too much.

dismissalText.commentary: Khaya Zondo c sub (MK Pandey) b Chahal 17 (38b 0x4 0x6 64m) SR: 44.73

dismissalComment.html: Zondo takes the early release as he steps out and swings across the line. Chahal might have taken wickets like this in local leagues - just tosses it up slow at an off stump line and lets the batsman do the rest. Zondo nowhere near the pitch, head looking in the direction of midwicket, bat coming down from gully, feet pointed at square leg. The ball keeps it's trajectory and ends up on the off side, in extra cover's hands

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 14 (10b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 140

dismissalComment.html: dead in front. Morris done in by natural variation. It keeps low as he goes on the back foot. In the end, he has to get down on his knees and swipe across the line to try and make a sweep out of it. It skids under the blade and hits him on the back thigh, right in front of the stumps. No doubt there, it was pitching in line. India brought back a wristpinner to get Morris, they've got him first ball

stories.title: India's new gung-ho approach to the middle overs
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Johannesburg
stories.seoTitle: India's new gung-ho approach to the middle overs
stories.summary: In recent years, India have been beaten on flat tracks because their batsmen waited too long to accelerate. But on Wednesday in Cape Town, they began rectifying that

image.caption: Shikhar Dhawan nails a pull
image.longCaption: Shikhar Dhawan nails a pull, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, February 7, 2018

stories.title: Kohli's run addiction brings another high
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: Virat Kohli's run addiction brings another high
stories.summary: There was pace and bounce to contend with as well as a bout of cramps, and wickets kept falling around him, but India's captain, as always, found a way to score runs

image.caption: Virat Kohli looks to ride the bounce
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli looks to ride the bounce, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, February 7, 2018

stories.title: 'We haven't picked the wrong 'uns' - Duminy
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: 'We haven't picked the wrong 'uns' - JP Duminy
stories.summary: South Africa's senior-most batsman has conceded that India's wristspinners have 'assessed conditions better than us', and have bowled lengths that have denied his team the chance to hit the ball down the ground

image.caption: JP Duminy followed his two wickets up with a half-century
image.longCaption: JP Duminy followed his two wickets up with a half-century, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, February 7, 2018

stories.title: Kuldeep, Chahal could be 'a massive X-factor' at World Cup - Kohli
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal could be 'a massive X-factor' at World Cup - Virat Kohli
stories.summary: 'Every over they might pick up two wickets, that is the kind of belief they have in their abilities. The team has a belief in them, the team is backing them'

image.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal collected four wickets
image.longCaption: Yuzvendra Chahal collected four wickets, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, February 7, 2018

stories.title: Kohli runs his way to a hundred
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: Virat Kohli runs his way to a hundred
stories.summary: Virat Kohli, once again, broke many records while completing his 34th ODI hundred in Cape Town

image.caption: Virat Kohli's innings of 160* consisted 100 by running and 60 from boundaries

stories.title: Kohli, wristspinners trample South Africa again
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: Virat Kohli, wristspinners trample South Africa again
stories.summary: After the India captain smashed an unbeaten 160, Kuldeep Yadav and Yuzvendra Chahal shared eight wickets between them to put their side 3-0 up

image.caption: Virat Kohli soared to another hundred
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli soared to another hundred, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, February 7, 2018

stories.title: South Africa floundering but not yet in panic mode
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: Firdose Moonda: South Africa floundering but not yet in panic mode
stories.summary: They might be blighted by injuries and staring at the prospect of going 3-0 down, but South Africa quick Kagiso Rabada says the hosts have to be wary of overthinking their predicament

image.caption: Kagiso Rabada vents his frustration
image.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada vents his frustration, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Durban, February 1, 2018

stories.title: Dhawan confident that India have 'all bases covered'
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: Dhawan confident that India have 'all bases covered'
stories.summary: The India opener also defended Rohit Sharma's batting form, saying the India vice-captain required 'just one innings' to get back in form

image.longCaption: Shikhar Dhawan goes through a fielding drill, Galle, July 25, 2017

stories.title: India aim for 3-0 at South Africa's favourite ODI venue
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: India aim for 3-0 at South Africa's favourite ODI venue
stories.summary: A win ensures India cannot lose the six-match series, but injury-hit South Africa return to Newlands, a place where they've won 28 of the 33 ODIs played

stories.title: India's new gung-ho approach to the middle overs
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 4th ODI, Johannesburg
stories.seoTitle: India's new gung-ho approach to the middle overs
stories.summary: In recent years, India have been beaten on flat tracks because their batsmen waited too long to accelerate. But on Wednesday in Cape Town, they began rectifying that

image.longCaption: Shikhar Dhawan nails a pull, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, February 7, 2018

stories.title: Kohli's run addiction brings another high
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: Virat Kohli's run addiction brings another high
stories.summary: There was pace and bounce to contend with as well as a bout of cramps, and wickets kept falling around him, but India's captain, as always, found a way to score runs

image.longCaption: Virat Kohli looks to ride the bounce, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, February 7, 2018

stories.title: 'We haven't picked the wrong 'uns' - Duminy
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: 'We haven't picked the wrong 'uns' - JP Duminy
stories.summary: South Africa's senior-most batsman has conceded that India's wristspinners have 'assessed conditions better than us', and have bowled lengths that have denied his team the chance to hit the ball down the ground
